column5: Can anyone recommend a good place to buy decent minnows in the Ear Falls area? We will be there the week after walleye season opens.Thanx

[font size="1" color="#FF0000"]LAST EDITED ON May-10-01 AT 02:24PM (CST)[/font][p]The four seasons Sport shop, Mike and Pam have always been really good to my group. Call them early to have them set aside your order. (807) 222-2200. We have had our best luck with leeches. I always call ahead and order 5 pounds for one week for 6-8 guys....http://town.earfalls.on.ca/ go to the website for weather updates. good luck

[font size="1" color="#FF0000"]LAST EDITED ON May-10-01 AT 03:16PM (CST)[/font][p]Hey Hammerhead I agree with czy42strokes we go up to Lac Seul every year and are first stop is the Four Seasons Sport Shop. Great people, we also call in advance and order are leeches. Leeches work better for us to. Good luck fishing, were are you staying at and fishing.I have been there at different times of the season and always catch alot of walleyes. We have been staying at Scout Lake Camp nice place and people are always friendly. jeffster

Flying to a Showalter outpost camp. They are about 15 miles N of Ear Falls. They run a first class operation if you are ever interested in a flyin. The trip up to Ear Falls is a grind from N Central Ill.

Where are you from in N Central Illinois I'm from Ottawa and use to go to Ear Falls every year to fish out of Woman River fly in. Now we go to Red lake and fly with Viking Outpost. This year I'm also going to Red Lake and flying with Canadian fly-In fishing to Thiscket Wood lake.Good luck, Gary
Hey Gary, I have a brother in law down by you in Streator that goes fishing with me, we fish the women river every June and have done well every year. good luck
Does he work at the LaSalle County Nuclear Station? There are a couple of guys from ComEd's nukes that go there every year.

Jeffster,I stay at Scout Lake Resort every year too, but no luck with leeches we always knock 'em dead wirth the minnows. You obviously know something I don't. If you don't mind, please e-mail me. I'd like to prick your brain a little.
